alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:51PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Showers with gusty winds will impact portions of Morris, Sussex and northern Warren Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1049 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers with gusty winds over Echo Lake, or 15 miles east of Mount Pocono, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. Rains and higher elevation snows with lower visibilities possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Newton, Montague, Dover, Hopatcong, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Hackettstown, Boonton, Butler, Wharton, Rockaway, Blairstown, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Mountain Lakes, Stanhope and Riverdale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
